node.title: 'We felt like prisoners': Family disgusted by treatment from SA Health during recent trip
node.alt: A selfie of a mum with her two sons and her partner
node.description: A family forced to leave South Australia under police escort after being considered casual contacts on a flight into the state said they wereÂ "disgusted" by the lack of communication from SA Health.
node.content:
["A family forced to leave South Australia under police escort after being considered casual contacts of a COVID-19 case said they were \"made to feel like prisoners\" and were\u00a0\"disgusted\" by SA Health's lack of communication.", "Sarah Rollings and her family flew into South Australia from Melbourne to visit their family for a weekend on November 26.", "After they arrived, they found out via the SA Health website that there had been a positive case on their flight.", "Ms Rollings said that, while her fiance received a text, she was never contacted by SA Health to be notified of their exposure.", "The family got tested and went into isolation until they received their negative test.", "Ms Rollings said after that she called the SA Health hotline and was told they would be allowed to leave the state on their original flight home.", "However, as\u00a0the family was about to board the\u00a0flight, their names were called over the speaker\u00a0and they were eventually taken away by police into hotel quarantine.", "Ms Rollings said she was \"disgusted\" at the way her family was treated by SA Health.", "\"We were just left in the darkness, put in a hotel room until I had to call up and find out what was going on,\" she said.", "\"It was very poor communication from the team.", "Ms Rollings said the communication from SA Health was \"very poor\" and it was not until she contacted them that they were allowed to leave the state \u2014 under police escort.", "", "
Sarah Rolling's hire car in the middle of a police escort.(Facebook: Sarah Rolling)
", "\"We\u00a0don't want anyone else to experience what we have, because it's just not on,\" she said.", "\"It was hell.", "\"This isn't just about us. This is about Australian families, anyone travelling as a family need\u00a0to be aware of this. It's happened to us, so it can happen to you.\"", "The family has now returned home to Victoria.", "SA Health said SA Police are responsible for movements across the border.", "\"Risk assessments are undertaken for both positive cases, as well as [for] close contacts, with individual circumstances taken into consideration and relevant advice provided,\" SA Health said in a\u00a0statement.", "\"Close contacts are advised not to travel interstate or move quarantine location, but further assessments can be undertaken during a quarantine period to determine the level of risk and whether advice has changed.\"", "
New exposure sites released
", "South Australia recorded six new cases of COVID-19\u00a0on Sunday, including a second mystery case that is yet to be linked to previous cases.", "It brings the total number of cases recorded since borders opened to 42.\u00a0", "There were 11\u00a0new exposure sites added by SA Health on Sunday, including two close contact sites on two separate flights.", "", "
A case was at Istanbul Lounge in Kensington Park on Sunday.(ABC News: Gabriella Marchant)
", "The rest of both flights are considered casual contacts.", "Istanbul Lounge in Kensington Park was also listed as a close contact exposure location after a case attended the venue on December 5, between 10am and 12pm.", "The RAA Cafe at Mile End has been listed as a casual contact site three times, after a case attended the site on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday between 12pm and 2pm.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
